docs.title: Welcome to Moil Meeting
docs.text:
Moil Meeting provides a state-of-the-art video conferencing experience by transforming a single fisheye camera into a comprehensive meeting system. Utilizing the MoilApp processing engine (Moildev SDK), it delivers high-definition panoramic and ultra-wide 360° views, ensuring that every participant is clearly visible and engaged.

This system is engineered as a robust, cost-effective alternative to complex multi-camera arrays, offering intelligent room coverage and motion tracking in a streamlined application.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• 360° Room Coverage: Eliminate blind spots with a single fisheye lens.
  • Intelligent Tracking: AI-driven detection automatically focuses on active speakers.
  • Multi-View Modes: Instantly switch between Panoramic, Discussion, Patrol, and Presentation views.
  • Cost-Effective: Professional-grade conferencing without the high hardware costs.
  • Cross-Platform: Native support for Windows, Linux, and macOS.

docs.title: What is Moil Meeting?
docs.text:
Moil Meeting is a cutting-edge video conferencing solution powered by the MoilApp fisheye image processing engine (via the Moildev SDK). By utilizing a single fisheye camera, it delivers immersive panoramic and ultra-wide (360°) views, transforming standard video feeds into dynamic, encompassing meeting environments.

Unlike traditional multi-camera systems that are complex and expensive, Moil Meeting achieves full room coverage and intelligent participant tracking with a single device. This offers a streamlined, flexible, and cost-effective alternative for modern communication needs.

Plain-language summary: One wide-angle camera captures the whole room, and the software turns it into clear, focused views so everyone can follow the meeting easily.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
Moil Meeting provides a versatile suite of operational modes tailored to diverse meeting scenarios:

Mode Functionality Original Mode Displays the raw, uncorrected fisheye view for complete field-of-view monitoring. Discussion Mode Interactive layout focusing on multiple participants simultaneously. Global Mode Unwraps the fisheye image into a 360° panoramic strip for total room awareness. Patrol Mode Automates viewing by panning across the panoramic scene continuously. Presentation Mode Highlights specific regions of interest for focused content delivery. AI Tracking Intelligent algorithms that automatically detect and track active speakers.

docs.title: What is Fisheye Lens Technology?
docs.text:
The Fisheye Lens, technically referred to as a Fisheye Image Sensor (FIS), is an ultra-wide-angle lens characterized by a short focal length. It intentionally produces significant optical distortion to capture an extremely wide, often hemispherical, field of view (FOV).

Key Characteristic

A standard fisheye lens boasts a FOV exceeding 180 degrees, allowing it to capture nearly everything in front of the camera, albeit with barrel distortion that requires software correction.

docs.title: Technical Foundation
docs.text:
Based on research by Professor Chuang-Jan Chang, the Moil Meeting processing engine employs multi-collimator metrology and cartography principles to characterize the lens's projection. This technique maps the fisheye image onto a hemispherical coordinate system.

Any point on the 2D image plane corresponds directly to specific spatial angles relative to the camera's optical axis: - The image point reflects the Zenithal distance (α). - The sight ray reflects the Azimuthal distance (β).

This mathematical model normalizes the distorted image onto a virtual sphere, allowing for accurate re-projection into rectilinear (flat) views.

docs.title: Coordinate System
docs.text:
The system uses a spherical coordinate system defined by the optical axis (Z-axis).

Zenithal Angle (α) : The angle measured from the vertical optical axis (Z) towards the X- and Y-axes. It represents the deviation from the center of the lens.

Azimuthal Angle (β) : The angle of rotation around the optical axis (Z). It is measured starting from the positive Y-axis (0°) and rotating clockwise.

The Power of Software Correction

The sophisticated normalization and re-projection workflow described above is the core engine of Moil Meeting. It allows the software to take a distorted circular image and transform it into readable, natural-looking panoramic or zoomed views in real-time.

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text: This guide provides step-by-step instructions to install and run the Moil Meeting application on your system.

docs.title: Windows
docs.text:
Prerequisites for Windows

  1. Download and install OBS Studio.
  2. Open OBS and click Start Virtual Camera before launching Moil Meeting.

Start Virtual Camera in OBS Studio

docs.title: Linux
docs.text:
Prerequisites for Linux

  1. Disable Secure Boot in BIOS settings.

  2. Install the v4l2loopback kernel module:

    sudo apt install v4l2loopback-dkms

docs.title: Download Moil Meeting
docs.text:
1. Visit the Video Conference GitHub Repository (Releases).
  2. Download the appropriate installer:
    • Windows: FisheyeVideoConferenceSystem-v1.1.6.exe
    • Linux: FisheyeVideoConferenceSystem-v1.1.6-linux.7z

Repository Release Page

docs.title: Windows Installation
docs.text:
Step 1: Run Installer Right-click the installer file and select Run as Administrator to ensure proper permissions.

Step 2: Follow Wizard Proceed through the installation wizard, selecting your preferred destination folder.

Step 3: Access Application After installation, locate the application in your selected folder. * FisheyeVideoConference.exe — Launch the application. * unins000 — Uninstall the application.

Step 4: Launch You are now ready to use the Moil Meeting system.

Moil Meeting Application Interface

docs.title: Linux Installation
docs.text:
Step 1: Extract Archive Unzip the downloaded .7z archive file.

Step 2: Run Installation Script Navigate to the extracted folder and execute the install script:

./install.sh   # Install application

To remove the application later, use: 

./uninstall.sh # Uninstall application

Step 3: Launch Once installed, the application shortcut will appear on your desktop.

Moil Meeting on Linux Desktop

docs.title: Developer Installation Guide
docs.text: This section is for developers who want to run Moil Meeting from source code.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: Component Requirement OS Ubuntu or Windows Python Version 3.7 or higher Tools Git installed

docs.title: Setup Steps
docs.text:
1. Clone Repository: 

    git clone https://github.com/username/video-conference-using-fisheye.git
cd video-conference-using-fisheye

  2. Set Up Virtual Environment:

    • Windows: 
      python -m venv venv
venv\Scripts\activate
    • Linux/macOS: 
      python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate

  3. Install Dependencies: First, install core packages: 

    pip install opencv-python pyvirtualcam ultralytics pygrabber mediapipe
    Then, install all requirements: 
    pip install -r requirements.txt

  4. Run Application: Navigate to src and execute: 

    python main.py

docs.title: Post-Installation
docs.text:
Success

Installation is complete. Please proceed to the Usage Guide to learn how to operate Moil Meeting.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Issue Type Solution Windows Camera Ensure OBS Virtual Camera is active before launching the app. Run as Administrator if issues persist. Linux Boot Verify that Secure Boot is disabled in your BIOS settings. Linux Modules Check if the loopback module is loaded: lsmod | grep v4l2loopback. Developer Env Ensure your virtual environment is activated and Python version is >= 3.7.

For additional support, refer to the Operations Guide or contact the Moil Meeting support team.

docs.title: Modes
docs.text: Learn which mode fits each meeting or monitoring scenario. Each mode is optimized for a specific type of room activity.

docs.title: Original Mode
docs.text:
Purpose: Full-scope monitoring and situational awareness.

Displays the raw feed from the fisheye camera without de-warping. This mode is essential for seeing the complete, uncropped capture area, ensuring no detail is missed at the periphery.

docs.title: Discussion Mode
docs.text:
Purpose: Interactive team collaboration.

Facilitates dynamic interaction by combining a panoramic overview with zoomed-in views of specific participants. The layout is customizable, allowing users to adjust the number and position of viewports to match the meeting size.

docs.title: Global Mode
docs.text:
Purpose: International meetings and large-scale room coverage.

Designed for comprehensive visibility, this mode creates a split-screen layout showing a dual panoramic strip. It provides a flat, "unwrapped" view of the entire room, making remote participants feel as if they are seated at the center of the conference table.

docs.title: Patrol Mode
docs.text:
Purpose: Surveillance and automated presenting.

Automatically pans the view across the panoramic scene from right to left (or vice versa). This "scanning" behavior is ideal for monitoring large spaces or for presentations where the camera needs to dynamically shift focus across a stage.

docs.title: Presentation Mode
docs.text:
Purpose: Content focus and detail highlighting.

Allows the presenter to lock onto a specific "Anypoint" area. The software de-warps and zooms into this region, providing a clear, distortion-free view of a whiteboard, speaker, or screen, minimizing visual distractions from the rest of the room.

docs.title: AI Tracking
docs.text:
Intelligent Participant Detection

Available across all modes, AI Tracking uses sound localization and motion detection to automatically steer the virtual camera view.

  • Sound & Motion: Instantly detects who is speaking or moving.
  • Auto-Focus: Adjusts the viewport to center on the active subject.
  • Toggleable: Can be enabled/disabled instantly for manual control when needed.

Optimizing Your Experience

Combine AI Tracking with the appropriate mode:

  • Discussion Mode: Automatically highlight speakers in a panel.
  • Presentation Mode: Follow a lecturer walking across a stage.

docs.text: Use this guide to run Moil Meeting day to day. Start with the Quick Start Guide, then return here as a reference.

docs.title: Application Overview
docs.text: Fisheye Video Conference System is a video conferencing application designed with a streamlined and modern interface. Upon launch, users are immediately presented with the main dashboard for rapid access to core functionalities.

docs.title: Operational Modes
docs.text:
The application features several distinct operational modes, accessible via the bottom navigation bar:

  • Start Camera — Activates video capture for all modes.
  • Original Mode — Displays the raw, uncorrected fisheye view.
  • Discussion Mode — Facilitates interactive, multi-participant discussions.
  • Global Mode — Connects participants globally with panoramic views.
  • Patrol Mode — Automated surveillance scanning.
  • Presentation Mode — Optimized for content delivery and focus.

Main Interface with Mode Selection

docs.title: Quick Start Guide
docs.text: Welcome to Moil Meeting, a comprehensive solution for 360° video conferencing and surveillance. Whether hosting a remote meeting, monitoring a wide area, or delivering a presentation, this platform provides the flexibility you need.

docs.title: Initial Setup
docs.text: Launch the application to access the main interface.

docs.title: Media Source Selection
docs.text:
Click the START CAMERA button to initiate the video feed. You will be prompted to select a source:

  • Open Camera — Use a connected USB or built-in camera.
  • Load Media — Play a pre-recorded video file.
  • Camera URL — Connect to an IP camera stream.

Original Mode Active

Each source allows for detailed configuration, including resolution and frame rate adjustments.

docs.title: Switching Modes
docs.text:
Methods of operation can be switched dynamically. The application defaults to Original Mode upon initialization.

Discussion Mode

Patrol Mode

Presentation Mode

docs.title: Starting the Camera
docs.text:
Source Selection Dialog

Procedure:

  1. Click START CAMERA at the bottom of the interface.
  2. Choose your input source in the dialog:
  3. Open Camera: For physical devices.
  4. Load Media: For file playback.
  5. Camera URL: For network streams.
  6. Token: For authenticated streams.
  7. Click OK to proceed.

docs.title: Camera Controls
docs.text:
Playback Controls

Once active, use the control bar to manage the feed:

  • Stop Camera: Completely stops the video feed.
  • Pause Camera: Freezes the current frame.
  • Play Camera: Resumes the feed from a paused state.

docs.title: Start Recording
docs.text:
1. Click the Start Recording button.
  2. A confirmation message, "Recording Started," will appear.

Recording Active

docs.title: Stop Recording
docs.text:
1. Click Stop Recording.
  2. A "Recording Finished" confirmation will display the saved file path.

Recording Saved

docs.title: Original Mode
docs.text:
Displays the full 360-degree fisheye view. This mode shows the complete, distorted image as captured by the sensor.

360° Fisheye View

Key Benefits:

  • Total Coverage: Eliminates blind spots by capturing the entire room.
  • Situational Awareness: Provides full context for surveillance or large meetings.
  • Simplicity: No need for manual pan/tilt adjustments.

docs.title: Discussion Mode
docs.text:
Designed for multi-participant meetings, this mode creates virtual "cameras" from the single fisheye source.

Discussion Mode Interface

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Access settings via the Config Button:

Features: - Limit Person: Choose between 2, 3, 4, 6, or 8 participant views. - View List: Manage individual views (Pause, Reorder, Configure). - Layout Slider: Dynamically resize video windows. - Panorama: Toggle the panoramic strip at the top.

Participant Limit Selection

Panorama Toggle: - Show Panorama: Enables a wide strip showing the entire room context. - Hide Panorama: Focuses solely on individual participants.

Right-click Context Menu

docs.title: Global Mode
docs.text:
Displays a dual-panoramic strip, effectively "unwrapping" the 360° image into a flat view.

Global Panoramic View

Features: - Dual Views: View two different panoramic angles simultaneously. - Flip Controls: Orientation adjustment.

docs.title: Patrol Mode
docs.text:
Automates monitoring by panning the virtual view across the panoramic scene.

Patrol Mode

Features: - Instant Activation: Begins scanning immediately upon selection. - Dynamic Control: Use the slider to manually override or adjust the view.

docs.title: Presentation Mode
docs.text:
Focuses on a specific area of interest, such as a whiteboard or speaker, while minimizing distortion.

Presentation Focus

Usage: 1. Select Presentation Mode. 2. Use Dialog Transformation (Right-click) to fine-tune the region of interest.

docs.title: Configuration Panel
docs.text: Access system-wide settings via the Config Button.

docs.title: Camera Information
docs.text:
Displays technical details about the current video source.

  • Model & Version: Hardware and software identifiers.
  • Video Stats: Resolution and Field of View (FOV).
  • Update Check: Provides a download link if a new version is detected.

docs.title: View Labels
docs.text:
Toggle overlay labels for camera views.

Labels Visible

Labels Hidden

Reset Labels: Restores default naming and positioning.

docs.title: Advanced Controls
docs.text:
• Flip Camera: Correct orientation (Upside, Front, Downside).
  • Panorama Config: Fine-tune the alpha/beta angles and cropping of the panoramic view.
  • Resolution: Adjust output quality per view.
  • UI Scale: Increase or decrease interface size for readability.
  • Cache: Import/Export/Reset configuration cache.

docs.title: Right-Click Context Menu
docs.text:
Available in all modes for rapid access to view-specific tools.

  • View Information: Detailed stats for the specific view.
  • Save Image As: Capture a snapshot.
  • Show Original Image: Quickly toggle to the raw fisheye feed.
  • Pause View: Freeze a specific quadrant.
  • Configuration View Setting: Deep-dive into Anypoint transformation parameters.

docs.title: Anypoint Transformation
docs.text:
Customize how a specific view is de-warped.

Transformation Settings

Parameters: - Alpha/Beta: Adjust the viewing angle. - Zoom: Control magnification. - Lock AI: Prevent auto-tracking from moving this view.

Visual Adjustment Tool

Mouse Press Event

Mouse interactions significantly enhance navigation control across all modes.

docs.title: Drag to Move
docs.text: Click and drag within a view to shift the visible region.

docs.title: Double-Click to Expand
docs.text: Double-click any view to maximize it to full screen.

docs.title: Scroll to Zoom
docs.text:
Use the mouse wheel to zoom in and out.

Tip

Use Transformation and Adjusted Transform features to precisely focus on specific objects while referencing the original image for context.

For further assistance, please contact the Moil Meeting support team.

docs.title: Moil Meeting Desktop Application v2.0
docs.text:
Release Date: january 22, 2026

We are pleased to announce the official launch of Moil Meeting Desktop Application v2.0. This major release delivers a redesigned multi-mode workflow, richer configuration controls, and a more flexible media pipeline for professional 360-degree meetings and surveillance.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Moil Meeting v2.0 is a significant leap forward in usability and control. The application now emphasizes fast mode switching, advanced view configuration, and streamlined interactions so teams can operate complex meetings from a single interface.

docs.title: Highlights
docs.text:
• Multi-Mode Workflow: Dedicated modes for Original, Discussion, Global, Patrol, and Presentation use cases.
  • Flexible Media Sources: Start with USB cameras, video files, IP cameras, or token-authenticated streams.
  • Powerful View Controls: Right-click actions and Anypoint transformation for precise view tuning.
  • Unified Configuration: Centralized panel for view labels, orientation, resolution, panorama, UI scale, and cache.

docs.title: Core Features
docs.text:
• Expanded Source Selection: Choose Open Camera, Load Media, Camera URL, or Token when starting a session.
  • Mode-First Navigation: Bottom navigation optimized for rapid switching across operational modes.
  • Discussion Mode Configuration: Participant limits, view list controls, layout slider, and panorama toggle.
  • Global & Patrol Enhancements: Dual panoramic strips and automated scan controls.
  • Presentation Focus: Anypoint transformation tooling for accurate de-warped views.
  • Right-Click Context Menu: View info, snapshots, original view toggle, pause view, and configuration shortcuts.
  • Configuration Panel: Camera info and update checks, view labels, flip orientation, panorama config, resolution, UI scale, and cache management.

docs.title: Improvements
docs.text:
• UI Consistency: Cleaner layout and more predictable controls across all modes.
  • Rendering Performance: Smoother view updates and better responsiveness under load.
  • Tracking Reliability: Improved stability when mixing AI tracking with manual view controls.

docs.title: Bug Fixes
docs.text:
• Stability fixes for configuration persistence and cache operations.
  • Reliability improvements for right-click actions and view pausing.
  • General fixes to reduce rendering glitches when switching modes.

docs.title: Upgrade Instructions
docs.text: No special actions are required. Existing users can upgrade directly to v2.0. All user configurations and data will be preserved automatically, but we recommend reviewing the new configuration panel for updated controls.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
1. Download: Get the installer for your OS from the Download Center.
  2. Launch: Open the application and configure your camera.
  3. Explore: Use Help → What's New to tour the latest features.

Note

Need assistance or found a bug? Navigate to Help -> Report an Issue or contact the Moil support team.

docs.title: Changelog
docs.text:

Type Description New Multi-mode workflow (Original, Discussion, Global, Patrol, Presentation). New Media source selection with USB, file, IP camera, and token support. New Discussion mode controls for participant limits, layout slider, and panorama toggle. New Right-click view actions and Anypoint transformation settings. New Configuration panel for view labels, orientation, panorama config, resolution, UI scale, and cache. Improved Interface consistency and responsiveness across screen sizes. Improved Rendering performance and AI tracking stability. Fixed Reliability fixes for configuration persistence and mode switching.

For detailed guidance on using these features, please refer to the Usage Guide.

docs.title: Usage Guide
docs.text:
Moil Meeting Application Interface

This section provides comprehensive guidance on using the Moil Meeting application, explaining components, features, and operational procedures to help users maximize the platform's capabilities.

docs.title: Core Workflow
docs.text: To get the most out of Moil Meeting, we recommend the following operational flow:

docs.title: 1. Initialize
docs.text:
• Start Camera: Begin by selecting your video source (USB, IP, or File).
  • Original Mode: Verify your camera angle and lighting in the default view.

docs.title: 2. Configure
docs.text:
• Select Mode: Choose the operational mode that fits your meeting type (e.g., Discussion for team meetings, Presentation for lectures).
  • Adjust Views: Use the Layout Slider and right-click menus to arrange participant views.

docs.title: 3. Operate
docs.text:
• AI Tracking: Enable for hands-free camera control.
  • Recording: Capture important sessions directly to your local drive.

docs.title: Operations Breakdown
docs.text:
For specific instructions, refer to the detailed sections below:

Section Content Camera Controls Starting, stopping, and selecting media sources. Mode Selection detailed breakdown of Original, Discussion, Global, Patrol, and Presentation modes. Recording How to start, stop, and manage video recordings. Configuration Adjusting resolution, orientation, and UI settings.

Pro Tip

Right-click on any view to access quick actions like Save Image or Pause View without opening the main settings menu.
